name: French in a Flash: Broccoli Gratin
description: A streamlined broccoli gratin is so easy if you use crème fraîche instead of béchamel, and you still get that toasted, gooey, cheesy, crunchy top.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Blanch the broccoli in salted boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain.

Toss the broccoli with the cream fraîche, three quarters of the cheese, and salt and pepper. Spoon the broccoli mixture into a greased baking dish. Top with the panko, and the remaining cheese. Bake until the top is golden and bubbling—30 to 35 minutes.
